desc.p: This field will contain a time period defining the time band to which the underlying rate will apply. The field will be in the form 'nnnD', 'nnW', 'nnM' or 'nnY'.
This field signifies the mortgage interest rate that is application at the time defined by the effective date in the key field.
This field signifies the band rate defined for the time band and amount band associated to it. If this bucket is chosen the this rate will be used by the underlying contract.
If this field exists then it is used as the rate.

The key to the mortgage rate control history file. The key consists of three components as shown under : 1. The sequence numner 1-99 as in the case of the ID on the MG.RATE.CONTROL file. 2. The currency code. 3. An effective date in the YYYYMMDD format.
This field specifies an amount defining the principal amount to which the underlying rate applies.
Contains the application dates for the rate specified in field OLD.RATE above.
